conclusion: Determine the velocity v_1 of the particles as they reach the collection device.
Particles are emitted from point S with a certain initial velocity v.
Particles move in a circular path due to the magnetic field.
Radius r_1 of the circular motion depends on velocity v, magnetic field B, and charge-to-mass ratio q/m.
Radius r_1 of the circular path for a charged particle in a magnetic field is given by r_1 = mv/qB.
Substitute given values to get r_1 = v/(2 x 10^6 C/kg x 5 x 10^-3 T) = v/10000.
Particle must reach the collection device on the positive x-axis.
Distance from S to the x-axis is d = 1.2 m.
For a particle to reach the x-axis, its circular path must intersect the x-axis.
Minimum radius r_1 for which the particle can reach the x-axis is when the center of the circular path is directly above the x-axis, implying r_1 >= d/2.
Substitute d = 1.2 m to get r_1 >= 0.6 m.
Using relation r_1 = v/10000, set 0.6 = v_1/10000.
Solve for v_1 to get v_1 = 0.6 x 10000 = 6000 m/s.
The particle velocity v_1 when it reaches the collection device must be 6000 m/s.
